'''Doublade''' ([[List of Japanese Pokémon names|Japanese]]: '''ニダンギル''' ''Nidangill'') is a dual-type {{2t|Steel|Ghost}} {{OBP|Pokémon|species}} introduced in [[Generation VI]].

It [[evolution|evolves]] from {{p|Honedge}} starting at [[level]] 35 and evolves into {{p|Aegislash}} when exposed to a [[Dusk Stone]].

==Biology==
Doublade resembles two swords sheathed on a plaque. Each sword has a pink eye with a black, linear pupil on the hilt, as well as a pink, tassel-like arm emerging from the handle. The swords are able to communicate telepathically, and they use this ability to carry out complex attacks that are unstoppable even to those skilled at swordplay.

==In the anime==
[[File:Sawyer Doublade.png|thumb|left|250px|Doublade in the {{pkmn|anime}}]]
===Major appearances===
Doublade debuted in ''[[M17|Diancie and the Cocoon of Destruction]]'', under the ownership of [[Argus Steel]].

A Doublade made its main series debut in ''[[XY119|A Full-Strength Battle Surprise!]]'', under the ownership of [[Sawyer]], where it is revealed to have [[Evolution|evolved]] from his {{p|Honedge}}. It evolved into {{p|Aegislash}} sometime before ''[[XY126|Valuable Experience for All!]]''.

==Trivia==
* Doublade is the [[List of Pokémon with unique base stat totals|only Pokémon]] with a base stat total of 448.
* No other Pokémon has the same [[List of Pokémon with unique type combinations|type combination]] as Doublade or its {{p|Honedge|evolutionary}} {{p|Aegislash|relatives}}.
* Doublade, along with its {{p|Honedge|evolutionary}} {{p|Aegislash|relatives}}, were designed by [[Hitoshi Ariga]].<ref>[http://hitoshiariga.deviantart.com/art/Pocket-Monsters-XY-413536751 Pocket Monsters XY by HitoshiAriga on deviantART]</ref>

===Origin===
Doublade appears to be based conceptually on a pair of fully sentient, possessed {{wp|magic sword|magical sword}}s. Considering the crossed swords and {{wp|shield}} connecting the Pokémon together, it is probably based on a {{wp|coat of arms}}. The fact that it started off as an ordinary sword as a {{p|Honedge}} may mean it could be based on the {{wp|bushido}} mythos behind {{wp|katana}} use; katanas possessed the user {{wp|samurai}}'s soul and attacked of its own free will. Visually, considering its build and hilt, Doublade seems to be based on a pair of either {{wp|spatha}}, {{wp|claymore}}, or possibly {{wp|jian}} swords with their own {{wp|scabbard}}s, {{wp|Hilt#Sword knot|tassel}}-like prehensile limbs, and a shared shield connecting its scabbards together.

====Name origin====
Doublade is a combination of ''double'' and ''blade''.

Nidangill may be a combination of 二 ''ni'' (two), 断 ''dan'' (to sever), and 斬る ''kiru'' (to slay with a blade) or ''kill''.
